data.title: A brief history of the Hooters bar
data.meta_description: The restaurant chain is known for its waitresses, who are typically young women dressed in revealing outfits. The restaurants also feature sports on multiple screens, as well as a menu of casual…
data.text:
The restaurant chain is known for its waitresses, who are typically young women dressed in revealing outfits. The restaurants also feature sports on multiple screens, as well as a menu of casual dining favorites such as wings, burgers, and seafood.

The first Hooters location was opened in Clearwater, Florida, in 1983. The founders of Hooters were six businessmen, including Lynn D. Stewart, who was a former salesman for Converse Shoes. Stewart had the idea to open a restaurant that combined two things he loved: sports and beautiful women. He convinced his five partners to invest in the idea, and the first Hooters restaurant was born.

The original Hooters restaurant was located in a small, rundown building in Clearwater. The building had previously housed a rundown bar, and the Hooters founders decided to keep the bar’s name, "Mother’s," as a tribute to its history. The original Hooters was not an instant success, but the founders persevered, and the restaurant slowly began to attract customers.
